sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"竞争"之意。
means: compete ： 普通用词，含义广泛。既可指体育活动等活动中争取优胜的相互竞争，也可指为了自己的利益与他人竞争。
contend ： 指为战胜或击败对手进行不懈努力，强调拼搏。也可指口头上进行有对立情绪或严重分歧的争论。
contest ： 指为争夺土地、阵地、权力或荣誉等而展开的竞争。
rival ： 指在两方或多方的竞争或比赛中，谁都想战胜或比得上对手。

sentence.Network_en: They are now trying to compete on an equal footing.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们现在想要公平竞争。

sentence.Network_en: Until the matter is resolved the athletes will be ineligible to compete.
sentence.Network_cn: 除非这个问题得以解决，否则这些运动员没有资格参加比赛。

sentence.Network_en: Schools should not compete with each other or attempt to poach pupils.
sentence.Network_cn: 学校之间不应该相互竞争，也不应该企图挖走彼此的学生。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin competere, in its late sense 'strive or contend for (something'), from com- 'together' + petere 'aim at, seek'

encyclopedia.content: 发音 英音：[kəm'pi:t] 美音：[kəm'pit]词性及解释中文释义 1.vi.竞争；比赛；对抗[(+with/against/for)] 2.（事物）媲美，比得上[(+with)]词义辨析 compete, contend, contest, rival这些动词均可表示“竞争”之意。 compete: 普通用词，含义广泛。既可指体育活动等活动中争取优胜的相互竞争，也可指为了自己的利益与他人竞争。 contend: 指为战胜或击败对手进行不懈努力，强调拼搏。也可指口头上进行有对立情

entry.def: When one firm or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its own goods in preference to those of the other firm or country. You can also say that two firms or countries compete .

example.ex: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various store cards...
example.tran: 长久以来，这些银行一直在与美国运通公司的信用卡以及各式各样的商场赊购卡竞争。

example.ex: The stores will inevitably end up competing with each other in their push for increased market shares...
example.tran: 在努力争取更大的市场份额的过程中，这些商场最终将不可避免地相互展开竞争。

entry.def: If you compete with someone for something, you try to get it for yourself and stop the other person getting it. You can also say that two people compete for something.

example.ex: Kangaroos compete with sheep and cattle for sparse supplies of food and water...
example.tran: 袋鼠与牛羊争夺稀少的食物和水。

example.ex: Schools should not compete with each other or attempt to poach pupils...
example.tran: 学校之间不应该相互竞争，也不应该企图挖走彼此的学生。

entry.def: If you compete in a contest or a game, you take part in it.

example.ex: He will be competing in the London-Calais-London race...
example.tran: 他将参加伦敦至加来的航海往返赛。

example.ex: Dubbed foreign language films will not be allowed to compete for best film...
example.tran: 外国译制片不得参加最佳影片的角逐。

means.word_mean: 1. compete for something; engage in a contest; measure oneself against others

stems_affixes.word_buile: centri=centr中心+pet追+al……的→追求中心的→向心的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有能力的,能胜任的;足够的
竞争的;好竞争的;[价格等的]有竞争力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: compete[v.比赛,竞争]+itive……的→adj.竞争的;好竞争的;[价格等的]有竞争力的
per全部永久+pet追求,寻求+ual……的→追求永久的
pet追求,寻求+ulant多……的→追求太多,导致脾气不好
pro前+piti=pet追求,寻求+ous……的→在[别人]前面追到→幸运的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 食欲,胃口;欲望,性欲;爱好,趣味
stems_affixes.word_buile: ap一再+pet追求,寻求+ite表名词→一再追求→有胃口
appet=appetite胃口+izer东西→n.开胃食品,开胃物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 能力,胜任某种工作的资格
stems_affixes.word_buile: competent[[adj.有能力的,能胜任的;足够的]]省鷑.能力,胜任某种工作的资格
compete[v.比赛,竞争]+ition表名词→n.竞争, 竞赛
pet追求,寻求+ition表名词→追寻状态→请愿[词性变化:可做动词]
petition[n.请愿书,申请书 v.[向…]请愿,正式请求]+er人→n.请愿人
per全部,永久+pet追求,寻求+uate=ate表动词→追求永久
pet追求,寻求+ition表名词→追寻状态→请愿[词性变化:可做动词]
pro前+piti=pet追求,寻求+ate表动词→追到前面去→获宠爱

Sentence.sentence: To show its will to compete with Japan's Fuji photo.
It is well positioned to compete with the giants.
She speculated that professors might try even harder to make classes interesting if they were to compete with the devices.
They are usually more motivated to compete with their peers.
